sentences.en: ...he will be labouring 14 hundred metres below ground.
sentences.cn: …他将在地下1400米处艰苦劳动。

sentences.en: A million young people enter the labour market each year.
sentences.cn: 每年有100万年轻人进入劳动力市场。

sentences.en: a shortage of skilled labor
sentences.cn: 熟练工人短缺

sentences.en: A system of forced labour was used on the cocoa plantations.
sentences.cn: 可可种植园中曾实行强迫劳役制。

sentences.en: As rural factories shed labour, people drift towards the cities.
sentences.cn: 由于农村的工厂纷纷裁员，人们逐渐流向城市。

sentences.en: Con-struction remains a relatively labour-intensive industry.
sentences.cn: 建筑业相对来说依然是劳动密集型的行业。

sentences.en: Consultation is traditional in the consensual Belgian system of labour relations.
sentences.cn: 协商是建立在意见一致基础上的比利时劳资关系体系的传统做法。

sentences.en: electrical labour-saving devices around the home
sentences.cn: 节省劳力的各种家用电器

sentences.en: He became a colossus of the labour movement.
sentences.cn: 他成为了劳工运动中举足轻重的人物。

sentences.en: He might decide that it is best to induce labour.
sentences.cn: 他也许决定最好引产。

sentences.en: I could see the bus labouring up the steep, windy road.
sentences.cn: 我看到公共汽车迎着大风在陡峭的道路上艰难行驶。

sentences.en: I don't want to labour the point but there it is.
sentences.cn: 我不想反复重申，但还是不得不说。

sentences.en: I thought the pains meant I was going into labour.
sentences.cn: 我还以为这些疼痛意味着我要生了呢。

sentences.en: Latin America lacked skilled labour.
sentences.cn: 拉丁美洲缺乏熟练工人。

sentences.en: Many women do hard manual labour(= work with their hands ).
sentences.cn: 许多妇女从事繁重的体力劳动。

sentences.en: New industries demanded skilled labour not available locally.
sentences.cn: 新行业所需的技术工人在当地是找不到的。

sentences.en: the division of labour between the sexes
sentences.cn: 男女分工

sentences.en: The garage charges £30 an hour for labour.
sentences.cn: 汽车修理厂收取每小时30英镑的人工费。

sentences.en: Unemployment in Britain rose to 8.1% of the labour force.
sentences.cn: 英国的失业人数已上升至占劳动力总数的8.1％。

sentences.en: Workers withdrew their labour (= protested by stopping work ) for twenty-four hours.
sentences.cn: 工人罢工24小时。

sentences.en: you've been labouring under a bit of a misapprehension.
sentences.cn: 你被一点点误会蒙蔽了。

sentences.en: young people about to enter the labour market
sentences.cn: 即将进入劳动力市场的年轻人

words.tran_cn: 吃力的；费劲的；不自然的
吃力的；缓慢的；矫揉造作的
辛苦地；费力地；不流畅地
工作；劳动；分娩（labor的过去分词）
劳动；努力；为…所苦恼；艰难地行进（labour的ing形式）

phrases.tran_cn: 不厌其烦地解释（或讨论）
被（错误想法）蒙蔽（或误导）

trans.tran_cn: 劳动，工作，分娩，英国工党
努力做，劳动，艰苦地做，吃力前行
trans.tran_en: to move slowly and with difficulty

trans.tran_cn: 劳动； 努力； 费力地前行， 吃力地行动
trans.tran_en: to move slowly and with difficulty
